snippet.title: Mother of teen who killed himself files $5.3m wrongful death lawsuit
snippet.content:
Michelle Carter found guilty of involuntary manslaughter of boyfriend 0:36
A judge has found Michelle Carter guilty of the involuntary manslaughter of her boyfriend Conrad Roy III after encouraging him to kill himself. Courtesy: Fox News
June 17th 2017 2 months ago /display/newscorpaustralia.com/Web/NewsNetwork/Network News/World/
Mother of teen who killed himself files $5.3m wrongful death lawsuit. Image: AP Photo/Charles Krupa, Pool, File
AP
Share
THE mother of a teenager who killed himself has filed a wrongful-death lawsuit against her son's girlfriend who was convicted of manslaughter for encouraging him to take his own life. Lynn Roy is seeking $US4.2 million ($AU5.3 million) in lost future wages for her son Conrad Roy III.
Michelle Carter was convicted of manslaughter for encouraging Conrad Roy III to take his own life. Image: Matt West/The Boston Herald via AP, PoolSource:AP The lawsuit was filed against Michelle Carter last month in Norfolk Superior Court in Massachusetts on behalf of her son's estate. Roy was 18 when he died of carbon monoxide poisoning in 2014. The then-17-year- old Carter initially tried to talk Roy out of killing himself, but later urged him to do it through dozens of text messages. Carter was sentenced Thursday to 15 months in jail.
Conrad Roy III killed himself after being encouraged by girlfriend Michelle Carter through dozens of text messages.Source:Supplied Carter's lawyer argued that Roy was determined to take his own life and that Carter didn't cause his death.
